data.title: MEANTIME MAGAZINE ISSUE #3
data.meta_description: Have a good laugh at the strange, odd, and beguiling stories of olden Singapore in Meantime Magazine Issue 3: Funny Stories.
data.text:
Have a good laugh at the strange, odd, and beguiling stories of olden Singapore, including tantalising tales of animal sightings, an incredulous policy concerning our hair, and the country’s crap crusade.

In this issue:

A tiger roams a shop in Singapore’s Chinatown

Men with long hair talk about their locks and their pops

In pursuit of better toilet standards, an activist makes himself the butt of the joke

Trans women and naked sailors put on a show at Bugis Street in the 1980s

Residents have a laugh at their street names

…and more!

About Meantime Magazine

Meantime is an independent magazine documenting Singapore stories lost to time. Published annually, each issue uncovers our past through personal stories.

EDITOR Pang Xue Qiang WRITERS Pang Xue Qiang

Sharanya Pillai

Sheryl Lee

Tan Yin Lin

Toh Ee Ming

Wong Zioedy COPY EDITOR Asyraf Kamil PHOTOGRAPHERS Amrita Chandradas

Sherry Wong

Zachary Tang ILLUSTRATORS Benedict Tay
